snippet: The data for 2013 did not show, however, whether cost controls in the Affordable Care Act or the aftereffects of the recession were responsible for the slowdown.
abstract: Obama administration reports health care spending in United States totaled $2.9 trillion in 2013, up 3.6 percent from 2012; is lowest rate of increase since government started tracking it in 1960.
lead_paragraph: The data for 2013 did not show, however, whether cost controls in the Affordable Care Act or the aftereffects of the recession were responsible for the slowdown.
